refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for the content of annotations

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Annotations, like footnotes, have markers and wrappers that are necessary to support their presentation. The m:annotation-content mode is used to process the actual body of the annotation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing funcsynopsis elements in the “ANSI” style

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The funcsynopsis element has several possible renderings. This mode is used when the “ANSI” style of rendering has been selected and a non-tabular layout is being used.
See also: m:ansi-table, m:kr, m:kr-table, funcsynopsis-default-style, funcsynopsis-table-threshold, and funcsynopsis-trailing-punctuation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing funcsynopsis elements in the “ANSI” style

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The funcsynopsis element has several possible renderings. This mode is used when the “ANSI” style of rendering has been selected and a table will be used for layout.
See also: m:ansi, m:kr, m:kr-table, funcsynopsis-default-style, funcsynopsis-table-threshold, and funcsynopsis-trailing-punctuation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing attributes

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Each DocBook element in the source document produces a primary HTML element in the result document. The attributes associated with that primary element are obtained by processing the DocBook element in the m:attributes mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing ISO 690 biblioentry bibliographic entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: DocBook bibliographic entries come in two forms: raw and cooked. The biblioentry form is the “raw” form. When the bibliography-style parameter is “iso690”, this mode is used to process biblioentry elements.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing biblioentry bibliographic entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: DocBook bibliographic entries come in two forms: raw and cooked. The biblioentry form is the “raw” form. The m:biblioentry mode is used to process these elements.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing bibliomixed bibliographic entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: DocBook bibliographic entries come in two forms: raw and cooked. The bibliomixed form is the “cooked” form. The m:bibliomixed mode is used to process these elements.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for producing callout marks

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Callouts are processed in this mode to produce the callout marks (or “bugs”) used to indicate cross references between the callouts and their corresponding areas. This mode should only produce the mark, for example “①”. See m:callout-link.

By default, callouts are numbered sequentially from 1 within each listing. However, a dbdb processing instruction processing instruction placed in the areaspec can specify a different starting number. If the starting-callout-number db processing instruction starting-callout-number pseudo-attribute pseudo-attribute is an integer, that’s used as the starting number. If it has the special value “continues”, then numbering continues sequentially after the last callout number used in the preceding verbatim listing.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for producing callout links

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Callouts in a calloutlist can link back to the corresponding point in the listing or on the image. This mode is used to produce those links.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Post-process HTML chunks

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Every HTML chunk is processed with the m:chunk-cleanup mode. This mode makes sure that footnotes and annotations appear in the chunks where their references appear, adds navigation to the top and bottom of each chunk, etc. See .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Selects the chunk filename

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Every element that is identified as a chunk, see , will be called in the m:chunk-filename mode to obtain the filename for that chunk.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Performs the final-pass of processing on chunks

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Chunks (see ) are constructed in several passes. The last pass is in the m:chunk-output mode. This mode makes last minute adjustments and produces the individual chunk documents.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generates the page title for the chunk

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The page title, the title in the HTML head, is generated by processing the heading in this mode. This mode is responsible for removing markup from the title.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Create result documents for chunks

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When all of the chunk processing is finished, each chunk is processed in m:chunk-write mode. By default, this mode creates XSL result documents for each chunk.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing copyright years

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The year elements in a copyright are processed in this mode. This mode handles the separation (and possible collapsing) of years.
See also copyright-year-range-separator and copyright-year-separator, and copyright-collapse-years.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce a cross-reference to the element

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:crossref mode is used to generate a cross-reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the inherit separator

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Separators are now part of the generated text template, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the label in a cross-reference

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:crossref-label mode is used to generate the label in a cross-reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the cross-reference label separator

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Separators are now part of the generated text template, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the number in a cross-reference

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:crossref-number mode is used to generate the number in a cross-reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the cross-reference number separator

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:crossref-number-separator mode is used to generate the separator between a number and what follows it in a cross-reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the cross-reference prefix

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Prefixes are now part of the generated text template, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the cross-reference suffix

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:crossref-suffix mode is used to generate any text that follows a cross reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the title in a cross-reference

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:crossref-title mode formats the title in a cross-reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce details about a media object

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This mode is used to produce the details about a media object, such as a long description.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the short summary for a media object

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This mode is used to produce a short detail summary about a media object. This is most often used as the alt text for the object.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The primary mode for processing DocBook elements

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:docbook mode is the primary mode for processing DocBook elements. Critically, this means that if you import the DocBook stylesheets and wish to override some of the templates, you must make sure that those templates are defined in the m:docbook mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating footnote numbers

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A footnote processed in m:footnote-number mode renders the footnote number (or other symbol) associated with that footnote.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing footnotes

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Perhaps unsurprisingly, footnote elements are processed in m:footnotes. On the first pass, they’re rendered inline with appropriate footnote markers. The “chunk cleanup” pass moves them to an appropriate location.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a title page

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: All “block” elements that have a title (or another feature that constitutes a title) are processed in the m:generate-titlepage mode to generate their “title page”. Don’t be mislead by the term “title page”. For many elements, the title page consists of nothing more than a single header element.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate localization-specific text for an element

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This mode is used to generate text by applying the appropriate locale-specific template, see . When you apply templates in this mode, there are three parameters you can pass:

listitem.para: This identifies the localization key. If not provided, the local name of the context item is used.
The content of the element. If not provided, the empty sequence is used.

refsection.para: For example, in the context of a book containing several chapters,
Would generate something like Chapter 1 The Title.
Lists are generated with the m:gentext-list mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate localization-specific list for a sequence

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This mode is used to generate a list with local-specific separators, see . When you apply templates in this mode, there are two parameters you can pass:

listitem.para: A sequence of one or more items.
This identifies the localization key. If not provided, the local name of the context item is used.

refsection.para: For example, in the context of an authorgroup,
Would generate different markup depending on the number of authors. For example, in the English localization, it would generate:

varlistentry.term: Author Name, Second Author, and Third Author
Author Name, Second Author, Third Author, and Fourth Author

refsection.para: And so on.
Generated text not associated with lists is generated with the m:gentext mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce a headline title

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This mode produces the “headline” title for an element. This generally appears in the text where the element is formatted, but may also occur in the table of contents, the index, and other places.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the label for a headline title

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:headline-label mode is used to generate the label in a headline.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the headline label separator

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Separators are now part of the generated text template, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the headline number

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:headline-number mode is used to generate the number in a headline.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the headline number separator

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Separators are now part of the generated text template, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate the headline prefix

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Prefix text is now part of the generated text template, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the headline suffix

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Suffix text is now part of the generated text template, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce the headline title

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:headline-title mode is used to format the title element in a headline.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Determine the syntax highlighting options for an element

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A verbatim element that will be syntax highlighted is processed in this mode to determine the options for the syntax highlighter. The template must return a map. The default template returns the language attribute if one is present.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add script elements to the end of a document

refsection.title: Deprecated
refsection.para: The technique described here is no longer necessary. Modern browsers accept a defer attribute on the script tag to explicitly specify when scripts are to execute.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: One way to assure that JavaScript will only be invoked by the user agent after the DOM tree has been constructed is to put the script elements for that code at the end of the file.

The root element of each result document is formatted once in the m:html-body-script mode. Any elements constructed in this mode will be added to the end of the HTML body. The built-in implementation does nothing; this mode exists as an extensibility point. See also m:html-head-script.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Construct the HTML head element

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The m:html-head mode is used to produce the head element. This should include all of the metadata, links, scripts, etc. necessary to render the document correctly.
It is not supposed to be necessary to override this template. You can customize what is produced with the m:html-head-script, m:html-head-links, and m:html-head-last modes.
The order of elements produced in the head is:

listitem.para: Elements generated by the stylesheets automatically (title, scripts, links, and other elements).
Elements in the HTML namespace that are in the source document’s info.

refsection.para: In addition, elements generated in m:html-body-script occur near the end of the HTML body element.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add elements to the end of the head of a document

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Any elements constructed in m:html-head-last mode will be added to the very end of the HTML head element. The built-in implementation does nothing; this mode exists as an extensibility point.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add link elements to the head of a document

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Any elements constructed in m:html-head-links mode will be added to the HTML head element. The built-in implementation does nothing; this mode exists as an extensibility point.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add link elements to the head of a document

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Any elements constructed in m:html-head-script mode will be added to the HTML head element. The built-in implementation does nothing; this mode exists as an extensibility point.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing HTML table elements

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Where DocBook uses the HTML table model, it copies the definitions of the table elements (and the attributes on those elements) from HTML. The m:htmltable mode simply copies those elements and attributes to the result. When processing the contents of table cells, processing switches back to m:docbook mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Construct an HTML imagemap

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The imageobjectco element is processed in this mode to construct an HTML image map.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating divisions in an index

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Index processing, that is, the process of generating an index, involves collecting all of the indexterms together, collating them, and rendering them.
The terms are grouped alphabetically and each group is processed in the m:index-div mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating primary index entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When generating an index, each distinct indexterm is processed in m:index-primary mode to output its primary entry.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating secondary index entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When generating an index, each distinct secondary indexterm is processed in m:index-secondary mode to output its secondary entry.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating index “see” entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When generating an index, each indexterm that defines a “see” index cross-reference is processed in m:index-see mode to output the cross-reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating index “see also” entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When generating an index, each indexterm that defines a “see also” index cross-reference is processed in m:index-seealso mode to output the cross-reference.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating index tertiary entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When generating an index, each distinct tertiary indexterm is processed in m:index-tertiary mode to output its tertiary entry.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing funcsynopsis elements in the “K&R” style

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The funcsynopsis element has several possible renderings. This mode is used when the “K&R” style of rendering has been selected and a non-tabular layout is being used.
See also: m:kr-table, m:ansi, m:ansi-table, funcsynopsis-default-style, funcsynopsis-table-threshold, and funcsynopsis-trailing-punctuation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing function arguments

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This mode is used to process the parameters of a funcsynopsis in th K&R style. See funcsynopsis-default-style.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing funcsynopsis elements in the “K&R” style

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The funcsynopsis element has several possible renderings. This mode is used when the “K&R” style of rendering has been selected and a table will be used for layout.
See also: m:kr, m:ansi, m:ansi-table, funcsynopsis-default-style, funcsynopsis-table-threshold, and funcsynopsis-trailing-punctuation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing function arguments in a table

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When the tabular presentation of a “K&R” funcsynopsis is being generated, this mode is used to process the function arguments.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Process inline links

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: DocBook allows xlink:href to appear on most elements. All inline elements are processed in m:link mode to add a link around them if they specify an xlink:href.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating a list of equations

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If lists-of-equations is true, then a list of equations will be generated. This mode is used to process the equation elements (if any) to produce that list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating a list of examples

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If lists-of-examples is true, then a list of examples will be generated. This mode is used to process the example elements (if any) to produce that list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating a list of figures

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If lists-of-figures is true, then a list of figures will be generated. This mode is used to process the figure elements (if any) to produce that list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating a list of procedures

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If lists-of-procedures is true, then a list of procedures will be generated. This mode is used to process the procedure elements (if any) to produce that list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating a list of tables

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If lists-of-tables is true, then a list of tables will be generated. This mode is used to process the table elements (if any) to produce that list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating a list-of-titles

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When a list of titles (figures, tables, equations, etc.) is created, each element is processed in this mode to produce the list item that will appear in the list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Compute properties for a media object

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The media object elements are processed in this mode to extract their properties (input and output URIs, content types, etc.). See .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adjust the URI references to media objects

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Once the stylesheets have used the mediaobject-input-base-uri, mediaobject-output-base-uri, and mediaobject-output-paths to compute the URI of a media reference, the reference is processed in m:mediaobject-output-adjust mode. This is the stylesheet’s opportunity to make any final adjustments.

The context item for the template will be the attribute that contains the author’s original value. The adjusted value is passed in as the $adjusted-uri parameter. The value returned by the template is used in the HTML.
Here is an example that groups images, audio, and video files in their own directories:
refsection.programlisting:
<xsl:template match="@*" mode="m:mediaobject-output-adjust"> <xsl:param name="adjusted-uri" as="xs:string"/>
<xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="exists(f:uri-scheme(.))"> <!-- Don't mess with absolute URIs... --> <xsl:sequence select="$adjusted-uri"/> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:variable name="type" as="xs:string"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="../self::h:img">image</xsl:when> <xsl:when test="ancestor::h:video">video</xsl:when> <xsl:when test="ancestor::h:audio">audio</xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:sequence select="'media-cleanup-err'"/> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:variable>
<xsl:variable name="parts" select="tokenize($adjusted-uri, '/')"/> <xsl:sequence select="string-join($parts[position() lt last()], '/') || (if (count($parts) gt 1) then '/' else '') || $type || '/' || $parts[position() eq last()]"/> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:template>
refsection.para: In other words, if the adjusted URI for an image is path/to/somewhere.png, this template will return path/to/image/somewhere.png and make similar adjustments to the audio and video paths.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Compute URIs for media objects

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The media object elements are processed in this mode to extract their input and output URIs.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating the persistent table of contents

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If persistent-toc is true, the document will be processed in this mode to produce the contents of the persistent ToC. By default, this produces the same ToC as the m:toc mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for production numbers

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When a productionset is being formatted, the m:production-number mode is used to produce the prodution numbers.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate the Pygments options for an element

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When the Pygments syntax highlighter is being used, every element that will be highlighted is processed in this mode to generate options for the Pygments process.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode to generate a “list” presentation of revhistory

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The revhistory element can be rendered as a list or a table (see revhistory-style). The m:revhistory-list mode is used to render it as a list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode to generate a “table” presentation of revhistory

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The revhistory element can be rendered as a list or a table (see revhistory-style). The m:revhistory-table mode is used to render it as a list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Process a segmentedlist as a table

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Segmented lists can be presented in either a list format or a table format. If the tabular format is selected, the segmentedlist is processed in this mode to generate the table.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing segment titles in a segment

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: In a segmentedlist, each segtitle is processed once for each segment. This processing occurs in the m:segtitle-in-seg mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating the mark for a synopfragementref

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The synopfragment element allows a synopsis (for example a cmdsynopsis) to move common fragments out-of-line. The location where these fragments occur in the primary synopsis is indicated with a synopfragmentref. The stylesheets will generate a mark, analogous to the marks used for footnotes or callouts, to connect the reference to the fragment. The fragment will be processed in m:synopfragment-bug to produce that mark.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for processing programming language synopses

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The elements of class, method, and field synopses are processed in this mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Format a title

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This mode is used to format titles when they appear in headlines or cross references.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Format elements for the title page

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Elements that appear on the title page are processed in this mode to produce the text that will appear on the title page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Produce content in upper-case

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When formatting personal names in a style that requires converting a name to upper case (see ), this mode is used to generate the upper-case name.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Mode for generating lists of titles (e.g, the table of contents)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Elements are processed in m:toc when automatically constructing a Table of Contents (or, more generally, any list of titles).

Where a generated list of titles appears is controlled by several parameters. For manual control, place an empty toc element where you would like it to appear. If the toc element is not valid where you would like the list to appear, use the db-toc processing instruction instead. These must appear as the direct children of the element for which the list is being constructed.
See also generate-toc, generate-nested-toc, annotate-toc, lists-of-figures, lists-of-tables, lists-of-examples, lists-of-equations, lists-of-procedures, and section-toc-depth.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Format content for a list-of-titles

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When an element appears in the Table of Contents (or other list of titles), it is formatted in this mode to produce the entry in the list.

refnamediv.refpurpose: What elements are “nested” in a Table of Contents

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The elements processed in the m:toc mode determine where a Table of Contents will appear. When a Table of Contents does appear, the children of the starting element are processed in the m:toc-nested mode to determine which of them appear. This mode, for example, handles the maximum nesting depth of sections in the ToC.
